reviews.name: Optronics 55w Pair Driving Light Kit
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this set on my motorcycle for over 3 yrs and they work excellent, I use them primarily for night riding and have them hooked into my low beam switch thru a special harness purchased on line from another motorcycle enthusiast
reviews.title: Excellent Lights

reviews.name: Optronics 55w Pair Driving Light Kit
reviews.reviewText:
I installed these on the Highway Bar on my motorcycle with P-Clamps and used a relay kit available at a major Auto Store (3-Bobbleheads). Neat & Clean installation.
They are very bright for their compact size.
I've Had them for almost a year, then changed the bolts to Stainless Steel after the original bolts started slightly oxidizing.
The cost for a Light Kit for this same use from a motorcycle parts distributor is actually 3 times the cost of what I spent in this set up.
I will recommend these for the price
reviews.title: Great Lightsfor the $$$$

reviews.name: Optronics 55w Pair Driving Light Kit
reviews.reviewText: for the money, they are very hard to beat. highly recommend for moto, boat , or pick up truck - have them on all three of these
reviews.title: use on the moto, easy to install, bright,& compact

reviews.name: Optronics 55w Pair Driving Light Kit
reviews.reviewText: The lights were easy to install and very compact. I was very impressed with the brightness and the classic design of the lights.
reviews.title: Compact lights with big light capability.

reviews.name: Optronics 55w Pair Driving Light Kit
reviews.reviewText: I wasn't happy when I discovered that I spent $40.00 for the exact same lights at the Cleveland Intntl. Motorcycle show that Wal Mart had for less than $20.00! The lights are 55w and very bright! I have them mounted on my bikes highway bars and they really light up the dead space directly in front of the bike. I had the lighted switch mounted on the right side cover. The increased visibility is amazing! I rarely ever ride at night without them on. The only minor issue I've had is that when I turn the lights on, the right side light doesn't come on and if I give it a little "flick" with my index finger, it comes on and stays on. Probably just a slightly loose bulb. I'm planning on removing the lens to check that out soon. I'm just happy that if I ever need a replacement, I can get them at Wal Mart for a great price!! Thank you Wal Mart!
reviews.title: Bright lights!!
